title: Advice Columnist Offers Tips on Discussing Family Estrangements with Kids
snippets:
Kids grow up in all kinds of setups, advice columnist Eleanor Gordon-Smith writes. You can be led by what your son wants to know, without one big reveal

  • Read more Leading questions

I am estranged from my parents. I was once close to them but after having my son I could no longer justify their poor and hurtful behaviour and I made the difficult decision to cut contact with them. They always said they had no interest in...
titles: I’m estranged from my parents. How do I explain this to my child? | Leading questions
summary: Eleanor Gordon-Smith, an advice columnist, discusses navigating family estrangements and how to approach the topic with children. She suggests letting the child's curiosity guide the conversation rather than planning a single, comprehensive reveal. The context involves a parent who, after experiencing hurtful behavior, decided to cut ties with their own parents, who also expressed disinterest in having grandchildren. Gordon-Smith's advice is part of her series on addressing complex family issues.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it provides actionable insights to readers who may be dealing with similar family issues. It offers a solution on how to approach a difficult topic with children, contributing to the reader's understanding and decision-making process.

title: UK Invests £9m in Sickle Cell Treatment Expansion
snippets:
Government announces £9m funding to make specialist blood machines more widely available across NHS

People living with sickle cell disease in England are to benefit from quicker and more accessible treatment due to a £9m investment, the government has announced.

Apheresis services, which are a type of treatment that removes harmful components from a patient’s blood, are to improve across England through the funding of more specialist treatment centres. The funding will ensure the wider availability of machines that remove a patient’s sickled red blood cells and replace them...
titles: Sickle cell patients to have quicker and more accessible treatment in England
summary: The UK government has announced a £9m investment to enhance treatment for people with sickle cell disease in England. This funding will expand the availability of apheresis services, a treatment that filters harmful components from blood, by establishing more specialist centres across the NHS. This initiative aims to provide quicker and more accessible care for patients by increasing the number of machines that can remove sickled red blood cells.
constructiveness_reason: This story clearly highlights progress in the healthcare sector, reporting on a significant investment to improve treatment for people with sickle cell disease. It offers actionable insights about the expansion of apheresis services and the establishment of more specialist centres, which could empower patients and healthcare professionals.

title: China Supports Unprofitable Firms to Save Jobs Amid Data Challenges
snippets: China Forced to Keep Unprofitable Firms Alive to Save Jobs and Avoid Unrest  Bloomberg
Caller ID Is Destroying Our Understanding of the Jobs Market  Bloomberg
titles: China Forced to Keep Unprofitable Firms Alive to Save Jobs and Avoid Unrest - Bloomberg
Caller ID Is Destroying Our Understanding of the Jobs Market - Bloomberg
summary: China is actively keeping unprofitable companies afloat to preserve employment and prevent social unrest, reflecting a strategic move to stabilize the economy despite the inefficiency it may entail. Concurrently, the reliability of job market data is being undermined by the widespread use of caller ID, which affects the response rate to surveys, complicating efforts to accurately assess employment trends. These developments highlight challenges in managing economic stability and understanding labor market dynamics.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it provides insights into China's economic strategy and the challenges it faces in maintaining stability. It increases awareness of the trade-offs involved in supporting unprofitable companies to prevent social unrest, as well as the difficulties in accurately assessing employment trends due to technological factors.
